definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: Lieutenant Hearn fingered the magazine on his carbine.
sentences.chinese: 候恩少尉用手摸了一下卡賓槍的彈盒。

sentences.english: The world has enough junk rifles from Russia, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 世界上的俄羅斯垃圾卡賓槍已經夠多了，謝謝。

sentences.english: These carbines were in turn given to the Viet Cong.
sentences.chinese: 這些卡賓槍再被提供給南邊的越共遊擊隊。

sentences.english: Can some one lend me a double-barrelled rifle?
sentences.chinese: 誰能借一支雙響的卡賓槍給我？

sentences.english: At the same moment, he pressed the trigger of his rifle. The flame leaped forth.
sentences.chinese: 同時他扳動卡賓槍的扳機，噴出了一道閃光。

sentences.english: At first, the carbine rifle mainly uses for the cavalry soldier and the artillery.
sentences.chinese: 最初，卡賓槍主要供騎兵和炮兵使用。

sentences.english: As it is a cavalry carbine, it has no bayonet or socket for one.
sentences.chinese: 由於這是一個騎兵卡賓槍，它沒有一個刺刀或插座。

sentences.english: The Chinese have also exported these carbines to Central and South America.
sentences.chinese: 中國還出口這些卡賓槍到中美洲和南美洲。

sentences.english: Notheless, I do not see it is proper to carry a carbine with formal uniform.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲它是正確的攜帶與正規制服卡賓槍。

sentences.english: The carbine rifle acquires fame from this.
They sat there leisurely with their carbines on their thighs.
sentences.chinese: 他們悠閒地坐在那裏，卡賓槍放在大腿上。

sentences.english: The crack of Dalleson's carbine sounded again.
sentences.chinese: 達爾生的卡賓槍又砰地響了。

sentences.english: "Can some one lend me a double-barrelled rifle?" said Jean Valjean.
sentences.chinese: “誰能借一支雙響的卡賓槍給我？”冉阿讓說道。
